result.markdown: --- title: "Create a Comprehensive Report of All Variables in R" author: "Soundarya Soundararajan" date: "2023-05-01" categories: [EDA,data-overview, beginners] image: "kal-visuals-Y6fBphIg6Yo-unsplash.jpg" --- To effectively analyze data, understanding the characteristics of variables in the dataset is crucial. Generating a comprehensive summary of variables helps to identify duplicates, important variables, and necessary transformations based on their distributions. In this post, I will generate a summary report using the summarytools package in R, and also ahow how to avoid common mistakes. This technique is useful for datasets of any size and facilitates efficient data analysis. ## Libraries required ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} # Install pacman if you have not # install.packages("pacman") pacman::p_load("summarytools", "palmerpenguins") ``` ::: ## Summarize the data ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} view(dfSummary(penguins)) ``` ::: ## Output The output appears in the viewer pane, where categorical and continuous variables are charted with bar or histogram formats, respectively. ![Screenshot of the output](summarytools-screenshot.png){fig-align="center"} To save the output, simply click 'show in new window' and then right-click the opened browser window to save it to the desired location. ![](openinnew.jpg){fig-align="center"} ## Mistake to avoid A common beginner's mistake is to use the `View()` function instead of the `view()` function (with a small 'v'). The former opens the dataset in R, whereas the latter is a function of the `summarytools` package used to create the output. ## Why this works? I initially developed this summary report during my postdoctoral research, and my supervisor was impressed by its ability to provide a concise, one-page summary of important variables, complete with a graphic overview that is useful for downstream decision-making. > **Before you dive into the depths of data, take flight with a bird's eye view of the dataset at hand** ![Photo by KAL VISUALS on Unsplash](kal-visuals-Y6fBphIg6Yo-unsplash.jpg){fig-align="center"}
